title: Crowd sourcing data for autonomous vehicle navigation
abstract: Systems and methods are provided for controlling vehicle operation. A processor may access route information for navigation of a route by the vehicle including data relating to speed along the route and calculate a speed of the vehicle along the route based on the route information. The processor may cause the vehicle to be operated at the calculated speed along the route; obtain dynamic information for the route based on data collected from one or more other vehicles on the route and indicating current conditions on the route which affect the speed of the vehicle along the route; and cause the vehicle to be operated at an updated speed along the route, based on the dynamic information.
claims:
1. An apparatus of a vehicle for controlling vehicle operation, the apparatus comprising:
a processor; and
a memory including instructions, which when executed by the processor, cause the processor to:
access route information for navigation of a route by the vehicle, the route information including data relating to multiple speeds along the route;
calculate, based on the route information and the multiple speeds along the route, a target speed of the vehicle for a first area of a roadway located along the route;
identify one or more curves located on the route before at least a portion of the one or more curves is captured in an image, the one or more curves being identified based on a distance to the one or more curves determined based on a position of the vehicle along the route and a position of the one or more curves in the route information, the host vehicle being configured to navigate the one or more curves at a first reduced speed, wherein the first reduced speed is lower than a speed limit associated with the one or more curves;
cause the vehicle to be operated at the target speed in the first area of the roadway located along the route;
obtain dynamic information for the route, the dynamic information indicating current conditions on the route based on data collected from one or more other vehicles on the route;
calculate, based on the dynamic information, a second reduced speed for a second area of the roadway located along the route, the second area including the one or more curves, the second reduced speed replacing the first reduced speed and being lower than the first reduced speed; and
cause the vehicle to be operated at the second reduced speed in the second area of the roadway located along the route,
wherein deceleration of the vehicle is automatically applied to change the vehicle from the first reduced speed to the second reduced speed in advance of the one or more curves.
2. The apparatus of claim 1, wherein the dynamic information further indicates changed conditions for the navigation of the route.
3. The apparatus of claim 1, wherein the dynamic information indicates a hazard condition on the route, observed by the one or more other vehicles along the route.
4. The apparatus of claim 1, wherein the dynamic information is obtained from a server during navigation of the vehicle along the route.
5. The apparatus of claim 1, wherein the dynamic information indicates a change in traffic conditions that causes a change in speed for the one or more other vehicles on the route.
6. The apparatus of claim 1, wherein the target speed of the vehicle along the route is updated in response to environmental conditions encountered by the one or more other vehicles along the route.
7. The apparatus of claim 1, wherein the route information further includes data relating to a map of the route.
8. The apparatus of claim 1, wherein the target speed of the vehicle along the route is updated without driver interaction.
9. The apparatus of claim 8, wherein the target speed of the vehicle along the route is updated, during the navigation, in response to receiving the dynamic information.
10. The apparatus of claim 1, wherein causing the vehicle to be operated at the target speed along the route and the updated second reduced speed along the route is performed by a control system of the vehicle, the control system configured to control acceleration and braking of the vehicle.
11. The apparatus of claim 1, wherein the target speed of the vehicle along the route is calculated based on a prediction of navigation along the route.
12. A vehicle, comprising:
an autonomous driving control system to control operation of the vehicle; and
a navigation control unit, operably coupled to the autonomous driving control system, the navigation control unit comprising circuitry configured to:
access route information for navigation of a route by the vehicle, the route information including data relating to multiple speeds along the route;
calculate, based on the route information and the multiple speeds along the route, a target speed of the vehicle for a first area of a roadway located along the route;
identify one or more curves located on the route before at least a portion of the one or more curves is captured in an image, the one or more curves being identified based on a distance to the one or more curves determined based on a position of the vehicle along the route and a position of the one or more curves in the route information, the host vehicle being configured to navigate the one or more curves at a first reduced speed, wherein the first reduced speed is lower than a speed limit associated with the one or more curves;
cause the vehicle to be operated at the target speed in the first area of the roadway located along the route;
obtain dynamic information for the route, the dynamic information indicating current conditions on the route based on data collected from one or more other vehicles on the route;
calculate, based on the dynamic information, a second reduced speed for a second area of the roadway located along the route, the second area including the one or more curves, the second reduced speed replacing the first reduced speed and being lower than the first reduced speed; and
cause the vehicle to be operated at the second reduced speed in the second area of the roadway located along the route,
wherein deceleration of the vehicle is automatically applied using the autonomous driving control system to change the vehicle from the first reduced speed to the second reduced speed in advance of the one or more curves.
13. The vehicle of claim 12, wherein the dynamic information further indicates changed conditions for the navigation of the route.
14. The vehicle of claim 12, wherein the dynamic information indicates a hazard condition on the route, observed by the one or more other vehicles along the route.
15. The vehicle of claim 12, wherein the dynamic information is obtained from a server during navigation of the vehicle along the route.
16. The vehicle of claim 12, wherein the dynamic information indicates a change in traffic conditions that causes a change in speed for the one or more other vehicles on the route.
17. The vehicle of claim 12, wherein the target speed of the vehicle along the route is updated in response to environmental conditions encountered by the one or more other vehicles along the route.
18. The vehicle of claim 12, wherein the route information further includes data relating to a map of the route.
19. The vehicle of claim 12, wherein the target speed of the vehicle along the route is updated without driver interaction.
20. The vehicle of claim 19, wherein the target speed of the vehicle along the route is updated, during the navigation, in response to receiving the dynamic information.
21. The vehicle of claim 12, wherein the target speed of the vehicle along the route is calculated based on a prediction of navigation along the route.
22. At least one non-transitory machine-readable storage medium comprising instructions stored thereupon, which when executed by a processor of a navigation control system of a vehicle, cause the processor to perform operations comprising:
accessing route information for navigation of a route by the vehicle, the route information including data relating to multiple speeds along the route;
calculating, based on the route information and the multiple speeds along the route, a target speed of the vehicle for a first area of a roadway located along the route;
identifying one or more curves located on the route before at least a portion of the one or more curves is captured in an image, the one or more curves being identified based on a distance to the one or more curves determined based on a position of the vehicle along the route and a position of the one or more curves in the route information, the host vehicle being configured to navigate the one or more curves at a first reduced speed, wherein the first reduced speed is lower than a speed limit associated with the one or more curves;
causing the vehicle to be operated at the target speed in the first area of the roadway located along the route;
obtaining dynamic information for the route, the dynamic information indicating current conditions on the route based on data collected from one or more other vehicles on the route;
calculating, based on the dynamic information, a second reduced speed for a second area of the roadway located along the route, the second area including the one or more curves, the second reduced speed replacing the first reduced speed and being lower than the first reduced speed; and
causing the vehicle to be operated at the second reduced speed in the second area of the roadway located along the route,
wherein deceleration of the vehicle is automatically applied to change the vehicle from the first reduced speed to the second reduced speed in advance of the one or more curves.
23. The machine-readable storage medium of claim 22, wherein the dynamic information further indicates changed conditions for the navigation of the route.
24. The machine-readable storage medium of claim 22, wherein the dynamic information indicates a hazard condition on the route, observed by the one or more other vehicles along the route.
25. The machine-readable storage medium of claim 22, wherein the dynamic information is obtained from a server during navigation of the vehicle along the route.
26. The machine-readable storage medium of claim 22, wherein the dynamic information indicates a change in traffic conditions that causes a change in speed for the one or more other vehicles on the route.
27. The machine-readable storage medium of claim 22, wherein the target speed of the vehicle along the route is updated in response to environmental conditions encountered by the one or more other vehicles along the route.
28. The machine-readable storage medium of claim 22, wherein the route information further includes data relating to a map of the route.
29. The machine-readable storage medium of claim 22, wherein the target speed of the vehicle along the route is updated without driver interaction.
30. The machine-readable storage medium of claim 29, wherein the target speed of the vehicle along the route is updated, during the navigation, in response to receiving the dynamic information.
31. The machine-readable storage medium of claim 22, wherein causing the vehicle to be operated at the target speed along the route and the second reduced speed along the route is performed by a control system of the vehicle, the control system configured to control acceleration and braking of the vehicle.
32. The machine-readable storage medium of claim 22, wherein the target speed of the vehicle along the route is calculated based on a prediction of navigation along the route.
